title:
Empirical risk minimization for risk-neutral composite optimal control
  with applications to bang-bang control
abstract:
Nonsmooth composite optimization problems under uncertainty are prevalent in
various scientific and engineering applications. We consider risk-neutral
composite optimal control problems, where the objective function is the sum of
a potentially nonconvex expectation function and a nonsmooth convex function.
To approximate the risk-neutral optimization problems, we use a Monte Carlo
sample-based approach, study its asymptotic consistency, and derive
nonasymptotic sample size estimates. Our analyses leverage problem structure
commonly encountered in PDE-constrained optimization problems, including
compact embeddings and growth conditions. We apply our findings to
bang-bang-type optimal control problems and propose the use of a conditional
gradient method to solve them effectively. We present numerical illustrations.
